sentences.en: A new technique in lossless compression of remotely sensed imagery was proposed.
sentences.cn: 针对多光谱图像的冗余特点,提出一种多方式预测的多光谱图像无损压缩方法.

sentences.en: Even though the entire imagery had to be changed, the validity of those equations persisted.
sentences.cn: 纵使整个形象的描述都必须加以改变,这些方程也继续有效.

sentences.en: Have you scanned all the satellite imagery around the rocklyn building?
sentences.cn: 你检查过洛克林大楼周围的卫星图像了 么 ?

sentences.en: He argued that Shakespeare's plays were patterns of imagery.
sentences.cn: 他认为莎士比亚的剧本是形象塑造的典范.

sentences.en: Most of her poems abound in imagery.
sentences.cn: 她的诗歌大多数富于形象.

sentences.en: Music, mime and strong visual imagery play a strong part in the productions.
sentences.cn: 音乐、哑剧动作和强烈的视觉影像在表演中产生了强烈的效果。

sentences.en: She was horrified at the dehumanisation involved in much of the imagery.
sentences.cn: 这些意象在很大程度上表现出的人性泯灭让她深感惊骇。

sentences.en: Television is particularly suited to fantasy, imagery and multidimensional effects.
sentences.cn: 电视节目特别适宜于表现奇幻, 形象化的和具有多方面艺术效果的节目.

sentences.en: The pictorial imagery of symbols suits that role better than text does.
sentences.cn: 符号具有的图形表意的外在形象,比文本更适合担当这种角色.

sentences.en: Their dreams commonly involved complex stories with visual imagery.
sentences.cn: 他们的梦里常常有很多复杂的情节，充满了生动的画面。

sentences.en: Thermal imagery produces a visual record from natural heat radiating sources.
sentences.cn: 热图象由天然热辐射源产生一种可见的记录.

sentences.en: This is an ambitious and intriguing movie, full of striking imagery.
sentences.cn: 这是一部气势恢宏、引人入胜的电影，充满了动人心魄的瑰丽意象。

sentences.en: Unfortunately, this imagery and language colors our thinking more than we might admit.
sentences.cn: 不幸的是, 这种比喻和语言严重歪曲了我们的思维.

sentences.en: We can't afford one security - grade analyst going over imagery?
sentences.cn: 我们连让一名安全级别分析员分析卫星图像都不行 么 ?

sentences.en: When the form of aversive stimulation is unpleasant mental imagery the technique is known as covert.
sentences.cn: 当使用的厌恶性刺激是引起心理上不愉快的意象时,则称为“隐匿性敏感法”.

trans.tran_cn: 比喻，形象化的描述，意象，〈集合词〉像，肖像，画像，雕像，塑像术
trans.tran_en: the use of words or pictures to describe ideas or actions in poems, books, films etc
